page.title: 13WILDLIFE IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: Off London Road there is a lake which was a gravel pit until it was worked out in the 1960's. A housing estate has recently been built on part of the workings. Mr.C.Fletcher, who is the Water Bailiff for the local angling club, is not too optimistic about the future of the lake as a nature reserve. The building work has meant that people can get to the lake more easily. Some of them seem to enjoy breaking down trees, picking flowers and disturbing nests of many water birds. It is intended to cut a piece of the land off from the rest to form an island so that the wildlife can continue. Mr. Fletcher, however, does not believe that this will solve all of the problems.
